text: Hey, all. What’s the best way to make a simple narrow column within the DnD builder? Say my default 12-column container is 1200px wide. A single column in that container is a bit wide for readability, and I’d prefer say, 800px wide instead. Sans-DnD I would set `max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto;` on my container. However with DnD I’m unsure of the best approach. Offets? Spacers? Keeping responsiveness in mind as well.

<@UB690RZA7> I’m assuming you’re talking about at the template level, right? If so, I’d just add a `max_width=800` param on the `{% dnd_section %}` tag. That way the marketer is still in control as well if it ever needs to change at the page level.

Thanks, <@U26BLKGE4>! Yes, at the template level. Is there a way to do this on a row/module vs a section? My use case would be a narrow heading above another module that spans the full width of the container, all within the same section…reason being they may share a background color.

I could split it into multiple sections and set the background color to be the same for both sections, however it would get tricky if we’re talking a background image or gradient rather than a solid color.
In that case I usually do horizontal-spacer modules on either side. Not as precise, but I think the marketer experience is still preferable to putting a hard value on it via CSS
Right on. I’ll give that a try. Thanks man!
